Procedure Note
Patient: Agnes Skinner
Attending: Dr. Johnson
Steps:
1. Time out. GA induced.
2. Therapeutic suctioning of extensive mucus from Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem.
3. Navigated to RML lateral segment.
4. Radial EBUS confirmed concentric view.
5. TBBX x6 and TBNA x6 obtained. BAL performed.
6. Linear EBUS staging: Stations 11L, 7, 11Rs sampled with 22G needle.
7. ROSE positive.
8. Extubated stable.

Intervention: Bronchoscopic evaluation.
Actions: Clearances of the airways (suctioning of Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem) were executed. The RML mass was pinpointed using ultrasound. Tissue was harvested via needle aspiration and forceps extraction. Lavage was conducted. Mediastinal nodes (11L, 7, 11Rs) were interrogated and sampled using linear ultrasound guidance. Malignancy was verified.

OPERATIVE REPORT: The patient underwent robotic-assisted navigational bronchoscopy for a 4cm RUL mass. Following therapeutic aspiration of secretions from the Trachea, Right Mainstem, and Bronchus Intermedius, the Ion platform was utilized to navigate to the anterior segment of the RUL. Localization was confirmed via Cone Beam CT (CBCT) and Radial EBUS. A diagnostic TBNA was performed. Subsequently, therapeutic microwave ablation was delivered to the lesion in three overlapping sessions (RB1, RB2, RB3) at 90 degrees Celsius to ensure adequate margins. Post-ablation imaging confirmed successful targeting without complications.

Resident Note
Patient: Tabitha Twitchit
Procedure: Ion Bronch + Ablation
Steps:
1. GA / LMA.
2. Suctioned mucus from airways (Trachea, RMS, BI).
3. Registered Ion catheter. Navigated to RUL mass.
4. Confirmed with Radial EBUS and Cone Beam CT.
5. TBNA for diagnosis.
6. Performed Microwave Ablation (20min, 10min, 10min).
7. Final spin showed good ablation zone.
Plan: Admit for obs.

[Indication]
R91.1 Solitary Lung Nodule (RUL Mass).
[Anesthesia]
General, LMA.
[Description]
Therapeutic aspiration of Trachea, RMS, and BI performed. RUL mass accessed via Ion Robot. CBCT and Radial EBUS confirmation. TBNA x1. Microwave ablation performed x3 cycles to destroy tumor.
[Plan]
Admit for observation. Post-ablation CXR.

The patient presented for evaluation and treatment of a right upper lobe mass. We induced general anesthesia and first cleared the airways of mucus via therapeutic aspiration of the Trachea, Right Mainstem, and Bronchus Intermedius. Using the Ion robotic platform, we navigated to the target in the RUL anterior segment. We utilized both Cone Beam CT and Radial EBUS to confirm our position within the 4cm lesion. After obtaining a diagnostic needle aspirate, we proceeded to destroy the tumor using microwave ablation, applying energy in three distinct locations to ensure coverage. The procedure was successful with no immediate complications.

Operation: Robotic endoscopy with tumor destruction.
Technique: The airways (Trachea, RMS, BI) were cleared of secretions. The RUL lesion was approached via robotic guidance. Position was verified with 3D imaging and ultrasound. Cellular material was acquired. The mass was then ablated using thermal energy (microwave) in multiple passes to ensure eradication. Tolerance was excellent.

OPERATIVE SUMMARY: The patient presented for management of central airway obstruction. Inspection revealed a patent RML stent but significant (90%) malignant obstruction involving the distal trachea, right mainstem, and left mainstem bronchi. Argon Plasma Coagulation (APC) was utilized to ablate the endobronchial tumor tissue. Post-treatment inspection confirmed restoration of 100% airway patency. Additionally, therapeutic aspiration was performed to clear mucous secretions from the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem.

Procedure Note
Patient: Vernon Dursley
Attending: Dr. Johnson
Steps:
1. GA induced.
2. Scope inserted.
3. RML stent checked - OK.
4. Found 90% blockage in Trachea/RMS/LMS.
5. Used APC to burn tumor/open airway.
6. Suctioned mucus from all airways including Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem.
7. Result: Airway open.
Plan: Repeat in 4-6 weeks.

Vince was here for his airway check today 12/16 stent looks fine but he had regrowth in the trachea and both mainstems about 90 percent blocked so we used the APC to burn it back opened it up to 100 percent also had to suction out a lot of mucus from the lower airways specifically the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem patient did great extubated in room come back in a month or so.

[Indication]
Airway Obstruction.
[Anesthesia]
General.
[Description]
Diagnostic inspection: 90% obstruction Trachea/RMS/LMS. APC ablation performed. Patency restored to 100%. Therapeutic aspiration of mucus from Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem.
[Plan]
Repeat bronchoscopy 4-6 weeks.

Mr. Yound underwent a therapeutic bronchoscopy to address his airway obstruction. We found the previously placed stent in the RML was functioning well, but there was significant tumor regrowth occluding the trachea and mainstem bronchi. We utilized Argon Plasma Coagulation to ablate this tissue, successfully restoring full airway patency. We also suctioned a significant amount of mucus from the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem to further optimize his airway. He recovered well and will return for follow-up.

Operation: Endobronchial recanalization.
Details: The RML prosthesis was verified. Malignant strictures in the central airways were obliterated using thermal energy (APC). Patency was re-established. Secretions were evacuated via suction from the Right Mainstem, Bronchus Intermedius, and Left Mainstem. The subject was awakened without incident.
